item.description:
Hosted by A3D (African Development through Drum and Dance), Salem CultureFest 2011 will be going on all day Saturday, July 23rd and Sunday, July 24th.

This year there will be one central location for stage performers by the "gazebo". This family friendly festival will showcase much of the talent found in and around the Salem area, while also sharing the many cultures found locally.

In addition, there will be a family friendly parade. You are encouraged to join in and enjoy the diversity found right here in our community. There will be over 50 vendors participating with wares ranging from framed art and photos, several types of jewelry, pottery, balloons, toys, carvings, candles, hand-loomed scarves, food, shirts, hats, and more. Most of what you will find at this festival is handmade, available directly from the artists who crafted them.

Mark your calendar for this great FREE family friendly outdoor festival! Check out the A3D web site for more and updated info! http://www.A3Dinc.org/

-----------------

Stage Schedule:

Saturday
12:00 to 12:30 - Sisters In Dance (Belly Dancers)
1:15 to 2:00 - ROZO (World Music)
2:45 to 3:45 - Fab4Ever (Beatles)
4:30 to 5:30 - CV Boys (Cape Verdean)
6:30 to 7:30 - Djoliba Kan (Guinean Drummers )

Sunday
12:00 to 12:45 - Talent Quest TV Winners Circle (Young Talent)
1:30 to 2:15 - Pelaiah Auset and the F.A.M. Band (Soulful Singer/Songwriter)
3:00 to 3:45 - PanNeubean Steel (Caribbean)
4:30 to 5:30 - Zili Misik (Caribbean)
item.name: Salem CultureFest 2011
